job_title: Accountant 1 in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great community of employees and they are invested in furthering my career. I've been here for 1 year and I love it.
cons: I am a suburbs person so going to the city took some getting used to.

job_title: Medical Student in Joplin, MO
pros: You get to become a doctor.
cons: Continually raising tuition for students or attempting to. Mostly non clinical professors so you’re behind some peers when starting clinical years. The clinical doctors they do have teaching are great though. Simulation labs are underwhelming. No good feedback from simulated live patient encounters.

job_title: Assistant Director of Advising and Learning Enhancement in Kansas City, MO
pros: The PTO is amazing, the culture is welcoming, people are genuine and kind, leadership really care about the well-being of their employees.
cons: -Benefits aren't amazing, but aren't awful either.

job_title: Associate Provost in Kansas City, MO
pros: The people are wonderful. I feel we are all on the same team from the top administrator to the person emptying my trash. The onboarding and orientation were done well and very informative. IT have been very helpful. The units I have interacted with have all been cordial and wanting to assist.
cons: I am challenged with access to data which is a must to do my job. This is getting better one data element at a time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Joplin, MO
pros: Flexibility, pay, professionalism, great resources, friendly faculty and staff, student focused, onboarding process is great, equity between both campuses, small town culture in the works, diverse faculty and staff as well as with students, communication is clear with supervisor, good sense of community, KCU treats employees great!
cons: This is a new campus - still developing so sometime things are inconsistent. After hours do not support the needs of our students. The cafeteria food is not so great, compared to other cafeterias of the same brand/company, their prices are higher for less quality & portions, plus food and drinks are not included.

job_title: Learning Specialist in Joplin, MO
pros: KCU seems to truly care about their student doctors, their community, and their employees. You can "feel" the positive environment. KCU Joplin is well respected in the community because they live/practice their mission, vision, and values. KCU operates with flexible work schedule where you can work from home one day per week.
cons: There are no four day work weeks however; the flexible work schedule allows employees to work from home one day a week. They offer good vacation but they do not offer sick leave separate from vacation days as some other educational facilities do.

job_title: Director of Procurement Operations in Kansas City, MO
pros: KCU is a great place to work. The University is very successful. Co-workers are professional and personable. Facilities are excellent. Proximity to downtown and major highways is a big plus.
cons: There are no downsides to working at KCU.

review_title: Very happy I made the move to KCU
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Joplin, MO
pros: Great retirement match/contributions; A lot of paid time off days compared to non-higher education employers; Good benefit selection/reasonable cost; Good pay for Joplin area (not sure how KC campus compares to other KC businesses); Family friendly scheduling options compared to non-higher education employers (might vary by leader); Friendly coworkers who truly appear to enjoy their jobs
cons: Joplin campus doesn't have the amazing coffee shop that the KC campus has :). Nothing else really stands out at this time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: -5 weeks PTO (combines sick and vacation time together) -4 paid volunteer days -Wages seem to be on-par for position -Staff plan multiple kinds of community events
cons: -No reliable communication from administration -Segmented/interdepartmental collaboration is weak or nonexistent -Dismissive tone from administration/ "pizza party" mentality -Incredibly long times to fill vacant positions / large volume of turnover

job_title: Learning Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: Currently, I am in my 3rd month as a KCU employee. Although small in size, KCU is an excellent employer. The benefit package is one of the best reasons as to why one should join KCU. Employees are friendly, welcoming and supportive. In my role, I get to interact with students in person or virtually and each encounter has been positive. The facilities are well maintained and HR, security and IT departments are among the best. My supervisor and team are a great resource and have given me the time and space to continue to evolve in my role. Great experience thus far!
cons: No cons at this time.

review_title: Fantastic environment for students, faculty and staff!
job_title: Learning Specialist in Joplin, MO
pros: Some of the best reasons to work for KCU: Everyone is truly friendly. The environment is based on student success and guiding and nuturing the student to succeed.
cons: At this time I have no cons. Perhaps a breezeway from the parking lot to the buildings as the air is cold in winter.

job_title: Clinical Clerkship Coordinator in Joplin, MO
pros: The atmosphere is very positive and accepting. Everyone I've met is incredibly kind and I felt welcomed from the first day. I feel a great sense of purpose working at KCU.
cons: I truly cannot think of any at this point.

job_title: Associate Dean in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great working environment Great teamwork
cons: I am not sure at this point of time

review_title: Great Culture With Mission Driven Leadership
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: 1. Excellence in everything, from copy machines to food 2. Very welcoming and inclusive 3. Positivity abounds 4. Excellent facilities Great IT support
cons: Location, location, location, location, location

job_title: Assistant Professor in Kansas City, MO
pros: It has been a pleasure to work with everyone I have come into contact with. Everyone has a really positive attitude toward the university. I have had a great deal of support from upper management in my position.
cons: They have some processes in place that seem to take a long time to finish.

job_title: Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Amazing benefits Lots of advancement opportunities Flexible scheduling
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: My First Six Months at KCU
job_title: Administrative Assistant II in Joplin, MO
pros: Pay and Benefits are good. The People are very nice. The one day a week work from home is very nice! I really like working here.
cons: Cafeteria is a little pricey and no employee discount.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Joplin, MO
pros: everyone is welcoming and friendly. KCU culture of wellness and innovation is fantastic.
cons: The cafeteria could use more vegetables

job_title: Outcomes Research Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: The community, continuous learning, management
cons: I have to put something, so I suppose I could be making more money elsewhere.

job_title: Student Information Systems Analyst in Kansas City, MO
pros: KCU offer a good benefit package.
cons: Senior level members willingness to listen to faculty/staff feedback

review_title: Great place to work - can even be better with some creative effort
job_title: Executive Assistant II in Kansas City, MO
pros:
From the top down, this university is student-focused. 
The benefits here are the best you will find anywhere. The university truly cares about everyone who works here. During the 2020 pandemic/year of uncertainty and civil unrest the leadership has been supportive and encouraging. We were one of the first businesses to lock down to keep everyone safe. Not one employee was furloughed or let go.
cons: Budgets are tight and staff is stretched. There is little to no room for upward mobility for administrative professionals.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Joplin, MO
pros: Great benefits, decent salary, awesome coworkers, caring leadership
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: The people who work there are great and very helpful
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Kansas City, MO
pros: Great university with lots of stability and a long history of success.
cons: Few opportunities for advancement and promotion.

job_title: Full Time Faculty in Kansas City, MO
pros: Benefits are outstanding. There is a lot of great pockets of wellness and supportive culture. The students are awesome. Great facilities.
cons: Pockets of negative culture in some departments.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Taunted as the greatest place in Kansas City to work, KCU does have good benefits and attempts to make the work place supportive.
cons: Inconsistencies in what is said and what is expected tend to prevail.  New ideas are not openly excepted and employees are asked to attain a higher degree of professionalism than leadership exhibits.

job_title: Learning Specialist in Joplin, MO
pros: This is the best place I have ever worked. Lots of employers claim that they treat their employees well. KCU is NO JOKE! As an employee, I feel valued and appreciated. Excellent pay, great benefits, value of self-care, and a culture of caring.
cons: The only thing I would say KCU could do better at is working and collaborating as a team.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Professional dedicated workplace where you get to work with an engaged and professional team. They train medical professionals..
cons: The non memical support pay and benefits could be better but is still not bad. Not as flexible in scheduling as desired but for a small team not too bad.

review_title: Improving the well-being of the communities we serve.
job_title: in Kansas City, MO
pros: The mission of the university is fulfilled with each individual at every level of the organization. Makes work meaningful.
cons: There is much work to be done but it does keep it full of challenge and never dull.

job_title: Campus Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: Beautiful Campus, Great Benefits and Great Work Environment.  Paid Time Off and Volunteer Hours.
cons: Kansas City Campus is not in the best part of town, but security is awesome.  Very Safe Campus.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: The school has great benefits for the employees. But they are slowly dwindling.
cons: Management seems to be mean spirited and unprofessional.  There is almost a joy when someone gets let go by some of the management and it is not hidden.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Overland Park, KS
pros: Benefits, time off, pto,
cons: No growth, little pay for the work done

job_title: Clinic in Kansas City, MO
pros: work in a highly challenging environment
cons: communication less than it could have been

job_title: in Kansas City, MO
pros: Some great people in the mid management levels.
cons: Upper leadership is lacking and self motivated.
